name: places/ChIJT6uag51ZwokRBV2vUMM3FWQ
formattedAddress: 268 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 268 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009-4812, USA

originalText.text:
If your body aches from walking all over NYC, come here.

It's in an old building, and that's part of it's charm. The basement is where the saunas are. Plenty of fresh towels, cleaned slippers, cotton shorts and robes. We brought sports bras because it was a co-ed day and women need tops. We went on a Boris week.

The locker room has heated floors which is super nice after being out in the cold. It warmed my clothes, boots, and jacket up, which felt great.

The Russian room was the hottest I've ever been. Hotter than a black car in July in Texas by about threefold. It knocked the air out of me when I first stepped in, but after about 10 minutes, I felt the heat bliss and figured out the cold water buckets.

It was busy, about 45 people all trying to sweat their sins out. People were polite about scooting over to let folks sit down.

We spent about 2.5 hours there. Rotating between the multiple saunas, the cold showers, cold pool, hanging out and chatting with locals.

The roof patio was nice between saunas. It was 45¬∞f outside and felt crisp. The kompot was delicious and refreshing.

I got a platza and it was wonderful. My friend said her massage from Sasha was the best she'd ever had.

I left feeling like a brand new person. Warmed to my core.  I'd definitely say it was the coolest thing we did in NYC.

originalText.text:
I‚Äôve been visiting this place infrequently for years and overall it‚Äôs a great place to come and relax, maybe get a massage or a beer.  If I recall correctly, it used to have mostly men only hours and now it‚Äôs generally mostly coed.  The vibe during mens hours seems to have changed a bit.  Recently I stopped by early Sunday on a David day.  It was a little more crowded than I expected for that time slot.  I noticed that the staff kept going to the herbal steam room to tell someone to stop standing, and I didn‚Äôt know why.  I thought maybe it was some kind of safety thing, but people stand in the Russian room all the time and that‚Äôs hotter.  Later on, I tried visiting the herbal steam room.  Again there was a guy standing in front of the window facing the rest of the spa, so I couldn‚Äôt see how full the room was.  I went in and what do I see?  Two guys beating each other off and a couple other fellas admiring the scene and jacking off.  I left, and didn‚Äôt try to return to that room for the rest of my time there.  Maybe I should have reported it, but since I had seen staff telling people to stop blocking the window earlier, I think they know.  Perhaps they are reluctant to eject people for breaking the rules.  I don‚Äôt know if this is a regular thing, and I will not be visiting again outside of coed hours.

Just be advised to check the schedule before visiting, and plan accordingly.

originalText.text: I was so glad to get Natasha at the front desk who explained everything-- I got a half hour massage  with Johanna which was magic and put me in another world, then got a mud bath and salt scrub with victor. I felt great after.

text.text: I was so glad to get Natasha at the front desk who explained everything-- I got a half hour massage  with Johanna which was magic and put me in another world, then got a mud bath and salt scrub with victor. I felt great after.

originalText.text: I travel from Minnesota ever year for this place. Unique and straight to the point. The heat is REAL. Their sauna is the hottest, with a polar well built into the room. It's heaven here. The Russian platza massage is soo relaxing. The only knock I have of this place is prices have gone up, but it makes sense for the current market. You are lucky if u come here! Cheers.
